'C#' By convention, a number sign is used for the second
character in normal text; in artistic representations, sometimes a true sharp
sign is used: Câ¯. (pronounced see sharp) is a multi-paradigm programming
language encompassing strong typing, imperative, declarative , functional, procedural, generic, object-oriented (class-based), and component-
oriented programming disciplines. It was developed by Microsoft within its .NET
initiative and later approved as a standard by Ecma (ECMA-334) and ISO (ISO/IEC
23270:2006). C# is one of the programming languages designed for the Common
Language Infrastructure.

C# is intended to be a simple, modern, general-purpose, object-oriented
programming language. Its development team is led by
Anders Hejlsberg. The most recent version is C# 5.0, which was released on
August 15, 2012.
